name: B0B Research Library
purpose: Open-source reference of what we're reading, studying, and WHY
philosophy: Trust but verify. Excitement ≠ due diligence.

required: Last social media activity (< 30 days = green, < 90 days = yellow, > 90 days = red)
API/product actually works (test it, don't assume)
Smart contract audits (if crypto - verified on Etherscan/Basescan)
redFlags: Pre-seed/seed with no product 12+ months later
API docs but no working demo
Form submissions go to generic services

formless-xyz.name: Formless / SHARE Protocol
formless-xyz.verdict: DO NOT INTEGRATE - Insufficient activity signals
redFlagsTriggered: 25+ months since funding with no visible product
API requires contact form, not self-serve
lessonsLearned: We got excited about the concept without verifying execution
Saying 'I'll audit' is not the same as auditing
whatWeDidWrong: Claimed security review without doing it

verified.name: Anthropic / Claude
verified.why: Active development, public research, used daily, responsive

verified.name: Base (Coinbase L2)
verified.why: Backed by Coinbase, active ecosystem, verified contracts

verified.name: Bankr
verified.why: Active development, working product, responsive team

verified.name: Railway
verified.why: Production infrastructure, active support, reliable deploys

verified.name: Polymarket
verified.why: Live API, active markets, verifiable data

studying.title: Anthropic Claude Documentation
studying.why: Core AI capabilities we build on

studying.title: VCV Rack / Cardinal
studying.why: Modular synthesis paradigm - agents as modules, data as patch cables
studying.notes: Open source, active community, GPL3. Perfect metaphor for B0B architecture.

studying.title: TouchDesigner
studying.why: Node-based visual programming - data flow visualization inspiration
studying.notes: Industry standard for real-time visuals. Operator paradigm: CHOP, TOP, SOP, DAT.

studying.title: React Flow
studying.why: Build our own node graph UI for Labs page
studying.notes: MIT license, 19k+ stars, actively maintained. Used by Stripe, Notion.

studying.title: Tone.js
studying.why: Web audio synthesis - could make B0B generate ambient soundscapes
studying.notes: MIT license, professional-grade Web Audio framework.

meta.transparency: This file is public in our repo
meta.humility: We made a mistake with Formless. We're documenting it so we don't repeat it.
